com.smarthome.emulator.simulations.basis

Class Logger

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.smarthome.emulator.simulations.basis.Logger

  • public class Logger
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates and writes to three types of logs. Also stores server response time.

      • Logger

        public Logger(javax.swing.JScrollPane logScroller,
      javax.swing.JScrollPane toBeSentScroller,
      javax.swing.JScrollPane errorScroller)
        Creates new text areas for JScrollPane's given as parameters. Messages will be later writen to these text areas
        Parameters:
        logScroller - JScrollPane for log
        toBeSentScroller - JScrollPane for to be sent log
        errorScroller - JScrollPane for error log

        public void delete()
        Removes text area created in constructor from JScrollPane's view ports.

               long end)
        Adds new Response to responses list. Sets response value as start - end and time of response as end
        Parameters:
        start -
        end -

      • getLastResponseValue

        public java.lang.Long getLastResponseValue()
        If there are any responses in responses, returns value of last one, else returns 0L
        Returns:
        last response value or 0L

      • dumpResponses

        public void dumpResponses()
        Clears responses list

      • getNewResponses

        public java.util.ArrayList<Response> getNewResponses()
        Returns new ArrayList of Responses saved since last call of this method, then clears responses list
        Returns:
        responses saved since last call of this method

      • clearAllLogs

        public void clearAllLogs()
        Clears all logs text areas

        Shows errors:

        • LOGGER_CLEAR if failed to clear logs

      • getPrintDoc

        public boolean getPrintDoc(javax.swing.text.StyledDocument printDoc,
                  java.lang.String title,
                  javax.swing.text.Style[] styles)
        Gets texts from all logs and puts them into one StyledDocument given as parameter.

        Shows errors:

        • LOGGER_PRINT if failed to merge logs into one

        Parameters:
        printDoc - document to store all logs in
        title - title of document
        styles - array of styles to use (on 0 index regular style, on 1 index bold style)
        Returns:
        true if document merging successful, false otherwise

      • writeLogMessage

        public void writeLogMessage(java.lang.String msg,
                   int style)
        Writes message given as parameter to "log" text area in text style given as parameters (0 regular, 1 bold).

        Shows errors:

        • LOGGER_WRITE_LOG if failed to write to log

        Parameters:
        msg - message to be written
        style - style in which should be message written (0 regular, 1 bold)

      • removeFirstLineFromToBeSent

        public void removeFirstLineFromToBeSent()
        Removes first line from "to be sent log"

      • writeToBeSentMessage

        public void writeToBeSentMessage(java.lang.String msg)
        Writes message given as parameter to "to be sent log" text area

        Shows errors:

        • LOGGER_WRITE_SENT if failed to write to log

        Parameters:
        msg - message to be written

      • writeErrorMessage

        public void writeErrorMessage(java.lang.String msg)
        Writes message given as parameter to "error log" text area.

        Shows errors:

        • LOGGER_WRITE_ERROR if failed to write to log

        Parameters:
        msg - message to be written

      • isTrackResponse

        public boolean isTrackResponse()
        Returns if logger saves response times from server
        Returns:
        true if logger saves responses, false otherwise

      • setTrackResponse

        public void setTrackResponse(boolean b)
        Sets whether responses should be saved or not. Creates list of responses if there is not one.
        Parameters:
        b - true if save responses, false otherwise

      • isDumpResponses

        public boolean isDumpResponses()
        Returns whether there are responses stored or not.
        Returns:
        false if responses are saved, true otherwise

      • setDumpResponses

        public void setDumpResponses(boolean b)
        Sets if responses should be stored or not
        Parameters:
        b - false if save responses, true otherwise

        Returns:
